A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
After The Force Awakens and Rogue One\, I was ridiculously excited to see The Last Jedi. I prepped. I watched all of the previous movies (even the prequels) in order leading up to this film. I was in the first available 3D showing in my area on the 14th. It was all worth it.

Sure\, I experienced moments of disappointment and confusion during the flick. Particularly in reference to the answers I craved most from The Force Awakens. The story was a complete surprise compared to TFA. It had nothing that I expected. In short\, it was the movie I didn't even know I wanted. 

It wasn't perfect. I didn't walk out of the theater talking excitedly with my friend about how great it was.I had to wrap my head around it. Once I did that\, I realized that this flick actually made me like TFA less. It took Star Wars back to its roots and I loved it. I really can't wait to see what happens next.
